intro: Pabstiella sousae, commonly known as the Socotra starfish plant, is a unique succulent native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves that resemble the arms of a starfish. The plant is adapted to the arid and rocky environments of its native habitat, showcasing specialized structures for water storage and drought tolerance. Its leaves are typically blue-green in color, with a waxy coating that reduces water loss. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, Pabstiella sousae is considered a rare and endangered species.
